docs.snippet: New fitness tests are in part a response to increasing concerns of senior F.B.I. officials about the toll on agents after the attacks of Sept. 11, 2001....
docs.lead_paragraph: New fitness tests are in part a response to increasing concerns of senior F.B.I. officials about the toll on agents after the attacks of Sept. 11, 2001.
docs.abstract: Internal memo reveals that FBI has mandated fitness test for its agents for first time in 16 years; memo from director James B Comey reveals concern for agency's image, as well as concerns that agents have had less time for personal fitness due to systemic changes in years following Sept 11 attacks.

headline.main: Battling Crime and Calories at F.B.I. (Fit Bureau of Investigation)
headline.print_headline: Battling Crime and Calories at F.B.I. (Fit Bureau of Investigation)

docs.snippet: Detectives in Denver were on the hunt for an increasingly brazen shooter....
docs.lead_paragraph: Detectives in Denver were on the hunt for an increasingly brazen shooter.

headline.main: Police Testing Spent Shell Casings Faster to Solve Gun Crime
headline.print_headline: Police Testing Spent Shell Casings Faster to Solve Gun Crime

docs.snippet: American hopes of opening an embassy in Havana before presidents Barack Obama and Raul Castro meet at a regional summit this week have been snarled in disputes about Cuba's presence on the U.S. list of state sponsors of terror and U.S. diplomats' ...
docs.lead_paragraph: American hopes of opening an embassy in Havana before presidents Barack Obama and Raul Castro meet at a regional summit this week have been snarled in disputes about Cuba's presence on the U.S. list of state sponsors of terror and U.S. diplomats' freedom to travel and talk to ordinary Cubans without restriction, officials say.

headline.main: Cuba-US Warming Held Up by Listing of Cuba as Terror Sponsor
headline.print_headline: Cuba-US Warming Held Up by Listing of Cuba as Terror Sponsor

docs.snippet: The world should use military force to stop ISIS’ destruction of monuments....
docs.lead_paragraph: The world should use military force to stop ISIS’ destruction of monuments.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by New York Review of Books editor Hugh Eakin examines Islamic State's rampant destruction of art and monuments, calling on global community to use force to stop it; holds that by condemning destruction while citing an inability to intervene, Western governments are playing into extremists' hands and enabling violation of international law.

headline.main: Use Force to Stop ISIS’ Destruction of Art and History
